intro: Tolypeuma floridum, commonly known as the Florida flax or wild flax, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant features slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Tolypeuma floridum is often found in moist soils along stream banks and in wetlands, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
